conclusion: Analyze forces to determine pressure exerted by sphere D on spheres A, B, and C.
Sphere D is placed above spheres A, B, and C in a cone shape.
Weight of sphere D acts vertically downward; normal forces from spheres A, B, and C act on sphere D.
Weight of sphere D is W = mg.
Normal forces from spheres A, B, and C on sphere D are equal in magnitude due to symmetry.
Let the normal force from each bottom sphere on sphere D be N.
Resolve each normal force N into vertical and horizontal components.
Angle θ between line joining centers of sphere D and any bottom sphere and the vertical is 30°.
Vertical component of each normal force N is N cos 30° = N (√3/2).
Total vertical component of normal forces is 3N (√3/2) = (3√3/2)N.
Pressure exerted by sphere D on each bottom sphere is equal to normal force N.
Final answer: Pressure of D ball on each of the three balls A, B, and C is (2mg√3)/9.
